intro: Phanera khasiana var. tomentella, commonly known as the Khasi phanera, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of forests and is often found in the undergrowth. Its foliage and floral structure are adapted to thrive in the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological significance in its ecosystem.
